name: Mock
comment: The base class for all mocked objects.

log.name: log
log.comment: The unittest/mock.Mock.log of calls made. Only used if unittest/mock.Mock.name is null.

name.name: name
name.comment: The mock name. Needed if the log is shared; optional otherwise.

constructors.comment: Default constructor. Unknown method calls are allowed and logged, the mock has no name, and has its own log.

custom.name: custom
custom.comment: This constructor makes a mock that has a unittest/mock.Mock.Mock-custom.name and possibly uses a shared unittest/mock.Mock.Mock-custom.log. If unittest/mock.Mock.Mock-custom.throwIfNoBehavior is true, any calls to methods that have no defined behaviors will throw an exception; otherwise they will be allowed and logged (but will not do anything). If unittest/mock.Mock.Mock-custom.enableLogging is false, no logging will be done initially (whether or not a unittest/mock.Mock.Mock-custom.log is supplied), but unittest/mock.Mock.logging can be set to true later.

spy.name: spy
spy.comment: This constructor creates a spy with no user-defined behavior. This is simply a proxy for a real object that passes calls through to that real object but captures an audit trail of calls made to the object that can be queried and validated later.

calls.name: calls
calls.comment: Useful shorthand method that creates a unittest/mock.CallMatcher from its arguments and then calls unittest/mock.Mock.getLogs.

getLogs.name: getLogs
getLogs.comment:
unittest/mock.Mock.getLogs extracts all calls from the call log that match the unittest/mock.Mock.getLogs.logFilter, and returns the matching list of unittest/mock.LogEntrys. If unittest/mock.Mock.getLogs.destructive is false (the default) the matching calls are left in the log, else they are removed. Removal allows us to verify a set of interactions and then verify that there are no other interactions left. unittest/mock.Mock.getLogs.actionMatcher can be used to further restrict the returned logs based on the action the mock performed. unittest/mock.Mock.getLogs.logFilter can be a unittest/mock.CallMatcher or a predicate function that takes a unittest/mock.LogEntry and returns a bool.

Typical usage:

getLogs(callsTo(...)).verify(...);

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment: This is the handler for method calls. We loop through the list of unittest/mock.Behaviors, and find the first match that still has return values available, and then do the action specified by that return value. If we find no unittest/mock.Behavior to apply an exception is thrown.

verifyZeroInteractions.name: verifyZeroInteractions
verifyZeroInteractions.comment: unittest/mock.Mock.verifyZeroInteractions returns true if no calls were made

when.name: when
when.comment:
unittest/mock.Mock.when is used to create a new or extend an existing unittest/mock.Behavior. A [CallMatcher] [filter] must be supplied, and the unittest/mock.Behaviors for that signature are returned (being created first if needed).

Typical use case:

mock.when(callsTo(...)).alwaysReturn(...);

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides unittest/mock.Mock.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and unittest/mock.Mock.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the unittest/mock.Mock.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
unittest/mock.Mock.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to unittest/mock.Mock.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If unittest/mock.Mock.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of unittest/mock.Mock.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
